an optional path to an input file to load as the initial input to the mapping within the app.
an optional path to a mapping file to load as the initial mapping within the app.
do not open the app in the browser automatically.
the port to bind to.

subcommands.name: benthos blobl server
subcommands.raw_help_text:
NAME:
   benthos blobl server - EXPERIMENTAL: Run a web server that hosts a Bloblang app

USAGE:
   benthos blobl server [command options] [arguments...]

DESCRIPTION:
   Run a web server that provides an interactive application for writing and testing Bloblang mappings.

OPTIONS:
   --host value                    the host to bind to. (default: "localhost")
   --input-file value, -i value    an optional path to an input file to load as the initial input to the mapping within the app.
   --mapping-file value, -m value  an optional path to a mapping file to load as the initial mapping within the app.
   --no-open, -n                   do not open the app in the browser automatically. (default: false)
   --port value, -p value          the port to bind to. (default: "4195")
   --write, -w                     when editing a mapping and/or input file write changes made back to the respective source file, if the file does not exist it will be created. (default: false)
subcommands.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Run a web server that hosts a Bloblang app

options.description: execute a mapping from a file.
show help
Set the buffer size for document lines.
pretty-print output.
consume raw strings.
the number of processing threads to use, when >1 ordering is no longer guaranteed.

subcommands.name: benthos blobl
subcommands.raw_help_text:
NAME:
   benthos blobl - Execute a Bloblang mapping on documents consumed via stdin

USAGE:
   benthos blobl command [command options] [arguments...]

DESCRIPTION:
   Provides a convenient tool for mapping JSON documents over the command line:
   
     cat documents.jsonl | benthos blobl 'foo.bar.map_each(this.uppercase())'
   
     echo '{"foo":"bar"}' | benthos blobl -f ./mapping.blobl
   
   Find out more about Bloblang at: https://benthos.dev/docs/guides/bloblang/about

COMMANDS:
   server   EXPERIMENTAL: Run a web server that hosts a Bloblang app
   help, h  Shows a list of commands or help for one command

OPTIONS:
   --threads value, -t value  the number of processing threads to use, when >1 ordering is no longer guaranteed. (default: 1)
   --raw, -r                  consume raw strings. (default: false)
   --pretty, -p               pretty-print output. (default: false)
   --file value, -f value     execute a mapping from a file.
   --max-token-length value   Set the buffer size for document lines. (default: 65536)
   --help, -h                 show help (default: false)
subcommands.description: Execute a Bloblang mapping on documents consumed via stdin

options.description: Print only the main components of a Benthos config (input, pipeline, output) and omit all fields marked as advanced.

subcommands.name: benthos create
subcommands.raw_help_text:
NAME:
   benthos create - Create a new Benthos config

USAGE:
   benthos create [command options] [arguments...]

DESCRIPTION:
   Prints a new Benthos config to stdout containing specified components
   according to an expression. The expression must take the form of three
   comma-separated lists of inputs, processors and outputs, divided by
   forward slashes:
   
     benthos create stdin/bloblang,awk/nats
     benthos create file,http_server/protobuf/http_client
   
   If the expression is omitted a default config is created.

OPTIONS:
   --small, -s  Print only the main components of a Benthos config (input, pipeline, output) and omit all fields marked as advanced. (default: false)

options.description: show help

subcommands.name: benthos echo
subcommands.raw_help_text:
NAME:
   benthos echo - Parse a config file and echo back a normalised version

USAGE:
   benthos echo [command options] [arguments...]

DESCRIPTION:
   This simple command is useful for sanity checking a config if it isn't
   behaving as expected, as it shows you a normalised version after environment
   variables have been resolved:
   
     benthos -c ./config.yaml echo | less

OPTIONS:
   --help, -h  show help (default: false)
subcommands.description: Parse a config file and echo back a normalised version

options.description: Print linting errors for the presence of deprecated fields.
Print linting errors when components do not have labels.
Do not produce lint errors when environment interpolations exist without defaults within configs but aren't defined.

subcommands.name: benthos lint
subcommands.raw_help_text:
NAME:
   benthos lint - Parse Benthos configs and report any linting errors

USAGE:
   benthos lint [command options] [arguments...]

DESCRIPTION:
   Exits with a status code 1 if any linting errors are detected:
   
     benthos -c target.yaml lint
     benthos lint ./configs/*.yaml
     benthos lint ./foo.yaml ./bar.yaml
     benthos lint ./configs/...
   
   If a path ends with '...' then Benthos will walk the target and lint any
   files with the .yaml or .yml extension.

OPTIONS:
   --deprecated          Print linting errors for the presence of deprecated fields. (default: false)
   --labels              Print linting errors when components do not have labels. (default: false)
   --skip-env-var-check  Do not produce lint errors when environment interpolations exist without defaults within configs but aren't defined. (default: false)
subcommands.description: Parse Benthos configs and report any linting errors

options.description: Print the component list in a specific format. Options are text, json or cue.
Filter the component list to only those matching the given status. Options are stable, beta or experimental.

subcommands.name: benthos list
subcommands.raw_help_text:
NAME:
   benthos list - List all Benthos component types

USAGE:
   benthos list [command options] [arguments...]

DESCRIPTION:
   If any component types are explicitly listed then only types of those
   components will be shown.
   
     benthos list
     benthos list --format json inputs output
     benthos list rate-limits buffers

OPTIONS:
   --format value  Print the component list in a specific format. Options are text, json or cue. (default: "text")
   --status value  Filter the component list to only those matching the given status. Options are stable, beta or experimental.

options.description: Disable the HTTP API for streams mode
Whether HTTP endpoints registered by stream configs should be prefixed with the stream ID

subcommands.name: benthos streams
subcommands.raw_help_text:
NAME:
   benthos streams - Run Benthos in streams mode

USAGE:
   benthos streams [command options] [arguments...]

DESCRIPTION:
   Run Benthos in streams mode, where multiple pipelines can be executed in a
   single process and can be created, updated and removed via REST HTTP
   endpoints.
   
     benthos streams
     benthos -c ./root_config.yaml streams
     benthos streams ./path/to/stream/configs ./and/some/more
     benthos -c ./root_config.yaml streams ./streams/*.yaml
   
   In streams mode the stream fields of a root target config (input, buffer,
   pipeline, output) will be ignored. Other fields will be shared across all
   loaded streams (resources, metrics, etc).
   
   For more information check out the docs at:
   https://benthos.dev/docs/guides/streams_mode/about

OPTIONS:
   --no-api                   Disable the HTTP API for streams mode (default: false)
   --prefix-stream-endpoints  Whether HTTP endpoints registered by stream configs should be prefixed with the stream ID (default: true)

options.description: An explicit name to adopt in this instance, used to identify its connection to the session. Each running node must have a unique name, if left unset a name is generated each time the command is run.

Whether to send trace data back to Studio during execution. This is opt-in and is used as a way to add trace events to the graph editor for testing and debugging configs. This is a very useful feature but should be used with caution as it exports information about messages passing through the stream.
The session ID to synchronise with.
A token for the session, used to authenticate requests. If left blank the environment variable BSTDIO_NODE_TOKEN will be used instead.
A token secret the session, used to authenticate requests. If left blank the environment variable BSTDIO_NODE_SECRET will be used instead.

subcommands.name: benthos studio pull
subcommands.raw_help_text:
NAME:
   benthos studio pull - Run deployments configured within a Benthos Studio session

USAGE:
   benthos studio pull [command options] [arguments...]

DESCRIPTION:
   When a Studio session has one or more deployments added this command will
   synchronise with the session and obtain a deployment assignment. The assigned
   deployment will then determine which configs from the session to download and
   execute.
   
   When either changes are made to files of an assigned deployment, or when a new
   deployment is assigned, this service will automatically download the new config
   files and execute them, replacing the previous stream running.

OPTIONS:
   --name value               An explicit name to adopt in this instance, used to identify its connection to the session. Each running node must have a unique name, if left unset a name is generated each time the command is run.
   --send-traces              Whether to send trace data back to Studio during execution. This is opt-in and is used as a way to add trace events to the graph editor for testing and debugging configs. This is a very useful feature but should be used with caution as it exports information about messages passing through the stream. (default: false)
   --session value, -s value  The session ID to synchronise with.
   --token value              A token for the session, used to authenticate requests. If left blank the environment variable BSTDIO_NODE_TOKEN will be used instead.
   --token-secret value       A token secret the session, used to authenticate requests. If left blank the environment variable BSTDIO_NODE_SECRET will be used instead.
subcommands.description: Run deployments configured within a Benthos Studio session

options.description: The session ID to synchronize with.
The single use token used to authenticate the request.

subcommands.name: benthos studio sync-schema
subcommands.raw_help_text:
NAME:
   benthos studio sync-schema - Synchronizes the schema of this Benthos instance with a studio session

USAGE:
   benthos studio sync-schema [command options] [arguments...]

DESCRIPTION:
   This sync allows custom plugins and templates to be configured and linted
   correctly within Benthos studio.
   
   In order to synchronize a single use token must be generated from the session
   page within the studio application.

OPTIONS:
   --session value, -s value  The session ID to synchronize with.
   --token value, -t value    The single use token used to authenticate the request.
subcommands.description: Synchronizes the schema of this Benthos instance with a studio session

options.description: Specify the URL of the Benthos studio server to connect to.
show help

subcommands.name: benthos studio
subcommands.raw_help_text:
NAME:
   benthos studio - Interact with Benthos studio (https://studio.benthos.dev)

USAGE:
   benthos studio command [command options] [arguments...]

DESCRIPTION:
   EXPERIMENTAL: This subcommand is experimental and therefore are subject to
   change outside of major version releases.

COMMANDS:
   sync-schema  Synchronizes the schema of this Benthos instance with a studio session
   pull         Run deployments configured within a Benthos Studio session
   help, h      Shows a list of commands or help for one command

OPTIONS:
   --endpoint value, -e value  Specify the URL of the Benthos studio server to connect to. (default: "https://studio.benthos.dev")
   --help, -h                  show help (default: false)

options.description: allow components to write logs at a provided level to stdout.

subcommands.name: benthos test
subcommands.raw_help_text:
NAME:
   benthos test - Execute Benthos unit tests

USAGE:
   benthos test [command options] [arguments...]

DESCRIPTION:
   Execute any number of Benthos unit test definitions. If one or more tests
   fail the process will report the errors and exit with a status code 1.
   
     benthos test ./path/to/configs/...
     benthos test ./foo_configs/*.yaml ./bar_configs/*.yaml
     benthos test ./foo.yaml
   
   For more information check out the docs at:
   https://benthos.dev/docs/configuration/unit_testing

OPTIONS:
   --log value  allow components to write logs at a provided level to stdout.

options.description: continue to execute a config containing linter errors
a path to a configuration file
import environment variables from a dotenv file  (accepts multiple inputs)
show help
override the configured log level, options are: off, error, warn, info, debug, trace
pull in extra resources from a file, which can be referenced the same as resources defined in the main config, supports glob patterns (requires quotes)  (accepts multiple inputs)
set a field (identified by a dot path) in the main configuration file, e.g. "metrics.type=prometheus"
EXPERIMENTAL: import Benthos templates, supports glob patterns (requires quotes)
display version info, then exit
EXPERIMENTAL: watch config files for changes and automatically apply them

name: benthos
raw_help_text:
NAME:
   benthos - A stream processor for mundane tasks - https://www.benthos.dev

USAGE:
   benthos [global options] command [command options] [arguments...]

DESCRIPTION:
   Either run Benthos as a stream processor or choose a command:
   
     benthos list inputs
     benthos create kafka//file > ./config.yaml
     benthos -c ./config.yaml
     benthos -r "./production/*.yaml" -c ./config.yaml

COMMANDS:
   echo      Parse a config file and echo back a normalised version
   lint      Parse Benthos configs and report any linting errors
   streams   Run Benthos in streams mode
   list      List all Benthos component types
   create    Create a new Benthos config
   test      Execute Benthos unit tests
   template  Interact and generate Benthos templates
   blobl     Execute a Bloblang mapping on documents consumed via stdin
   studio    Interact with Benthos studio (https://studio.benthos.dev)
   help, h   Shows a list of commands or help for one command

GLOBAL OPTIONS:
   --chilled                                                      continue to execute a config containing linter errors (default: false)
   --config value, -c value                                       a path to a configuration file
   --env-file value, -e value                                     import environment variables from a dotenv file  (accepts multiple inputs)
   --help, -h                                                     show help (default: false)
   --log.level value                                              override the configured log level, options are: off, error, warn, info, debug, trace
   --resources value, -r value                                    pull in extra resources from a file, which can be referenced the same as resources defined in the main config, supports glob patterns (requires quotes)  (accepts multiple inputs)
   --set "metrics.type=prometheus", -s "metrics.type=prometheus"  set a field (identified by a dot path) in the main configuration file, e.g. "metrics.type=prometheus"                                                    (accepts multiple inputs)
   --templates value, -t value                                    EXPERIMENTAL: import Benthos templates, supports glob patterns (requires quotes)                                                                         (accepts multiple inputs)
   --version, -v                                                  display version info, then exit (default: false)
   --watcher, -w                                                  EXPERIMENTAL: watch config files for changes and automatically apply them (default: false)
